Package controller.lobby

Class LobbyController

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
controller.lobby.LobbyController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class LobbyController extends Thread
Singleton class to handle all the lobbies

  • Constructor Details

    • LobbyController

      private LobbyController()
      Initializes the `clientManager` variable by calling the `getInstance()` method of the `GlobalClientManager` class. If an exception is caught during this process, it throws a `RuntimeException` with the message "Cannot get client manager instance". The constructor is marked as private, which means it can only be accessed within the `LobbyController` class itself.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception is caught during the initialization of the `clientManager` variable

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static LobbyController getInstance()
      method that returns an instance of the `LobbyController` class. It uses the Singleton design pattern to ensure that only one instance of the class is created. If the `instance` variable is null, it creates a new instance of the `LobbyController` class and starts it. If an exception occurs during the creation or starting of the instance, it prints the stack trace. Finally, it returns the instance variable.
      Returns:
      the instance of the `LobbyController` class

    • run

      public void run()
      This method continuously checks the status of players in lobbies and handles disconnections. It sleeps for 1000 milliseconds between each iteration. If a player is disconnected, they are removed from the lobby and their status is updated. The method also sets the call handler for disconnected clients to the LobbyController's handleLobbySearch method. If a client is not found in the ClientManager, a ClientNotFoundException is thrown. Any exceptions that occur during execution are printed to the standard error stream
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • findPlayerLobby

      public Lobby findPlayerLobby(String playerName) throws LobbyNotFoundException
      method that searches for a lobby containing a player with a given name. It takes in a String parameter `playerName` and returns a `Lobby` object. If the player is found in a lobby, the method returns that lobby. If the player is not found in any lobby, it throws a `LobbyNotFoundException`. The method is synchronized on the `lobbies` object to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player to search for
      Returns:
      the Lobby object that contains the player
      Throws:
      LobbyNotFoundException - if the player is not found in any lobby

    • createLobby

      public Lobby createLobby(String lobbyname, String host) throws LobbyAlreadyExistsException
      method that creates a new lobby with a given name and host. It first checks if a lobby with the same name already exists in the `lobbies` map, and if so, it throws a `LobbyAlreadyExistsException`. If not, it creates a new `Lobby` object with the given name and host, adds it to the `lobbies` map, and returns the new `Lobby` object. The `synchronized` block ensures that the `lobbies` map is accessed in a thread-safe manner.
      Parameters:
      lobbyname - the name of the lobby to create
      host - the name of the player who will be the host of the lobby
      Returns:
      the created Lobby object
      Throws:
      LobbyAlreadyExistsException - if a lobby with the same name already exists

    • getLobbies

      public ArrayList<Lobby> getLobbies()
      Returns the list of lobbies.
      Returns:
      the list of lobbies

    • joinLobby

      public Lobby joinLobby(String lobbyname, String player) throws LobbyNotFoundException, PlayerAlreadyInLobbyException, LobbyFullException
      method that allows a player to join a lobby.
      Parameters:
      lobbyname - the name of the lobby to join
      player - the name of the player to join the lobby
      Returns:
      the Lobby object that the player has joined
      Throws:
      LobbyNotFoundException - if the specified lobby does not exist
      PlayerAlreadyInLobbyException - if the player is already in a lobby
      LobbyFullException - if the lobby is already full and cannot accept more players

    • leaveLobby

      public void leaveLobby(String player) throws LobbyNotFoundException, PlayerNotInLobbyException
      Removes a player from their current lobby.
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player to remove from the lobby
      Throws:
      LobbyNotFoundException - if the player is not found in any lobby
      PlayerNotInLobbyException - if the player is not in a lobby

    • handleLobbySearch

      public Result<Serializable> handleLobbySearch(Call<Serializable> call, ClientInterface client)
      method that handles lobby search requests from clients. It takes in a `Call` object and a `ClientInterface` object as parameters and returns a `Result` object containing a `Serializable` object.
      Parameters:
      call - the Call object representing the lobby search request
      client - the ClientInterface object of the client making the request
      Returns:
      a Result object containing the result of the lobby search operation

    • handleInLobby

      public Result<Serializable> handleInLobby(Call<Serializable> call, ClientInterface client)
      method that handles incoming calls from clients who are currently in a lobby. It takes in a `Call` object and a `ClientInterface` object as parameters, and returns a `Result` object that contains a `Serializable` object.
      Parameters:
      call - the Call object representing the in-lobby request
      client - the ClientInterface object of the client making the request
      Returns:
      a Result object containing the result of the in-lobby operation

    • startGame

      public void startGame(Lobby lobby) throws Exception
      method called `startGame` that takes a `Lobby` object as a parameter and throws an `Exception`. It creates a `File` object representing a directory called `SAVESTATES_DIRECTORY` and checks if it exists. If it doesn't exist, it creates the directory. If it exists but is not a directory, it throws an exception.
      Parameters:
      lobby - the lobby in which to start the game
      Throws:
      Exception - if the game cannot be started for any reason (e.g. the save directory cannot be created)

    • loadGame

      private void loadGame(Lobby lobby) throws Exception
      Loads a save game from the specified lobby.
      Parameters:
      lobby - the lobby from which to load the game
      Throws:
      Exception - if the game cannot be loaded for any reason (e.g. the save file does not exist)

    • endGame

      public void endGame(GameController game)
      Ends the specified game.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameController object representing the game to end

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame(GameController game)
      Exits the specified game.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameController object representing the game to exit

    • searchGame

      public Optional<GameController> searchGame(String username)
      Searches for a game containing the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional object containing the GameController object representing the game, if found, or an empty Optional object otherwise

    • globalUpdate

      private void globalUpdate(Lobby lobby, ServerEvent event)
      method that takes in a `Lobby` object and a `ServerEvent` object as parameters. It synchronizes on the `Lobby` object and then iterates through all the players in the lobby. For each player, it tries to get the corresponding `ClientInterface` object from a `clientManager` and checks if it is present and not disconnected. If it is, it sends the `ServerEvent` object to the client using the `sendEvent` method. If the client is not present or disconnected, it logs a warning message. If there is an exception while sending the event, it logs an error message. This method is likely used to update all clients in a lobby with a new event.
      Parameters:
      lobby - the Lobby object to send the update event to
      event - the ServerEvent object representing the update event
